decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing them to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The key strategy is to generate mana quickly using cards like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal, while also generating card advantage with Thought Monitor. By efficiently casting low-cost artifact creatures like Frogmite and Skorpekh Lord, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Pithing Needle and Metallic Rebuke helps to control the opponent's resources and protect the deck's game plan.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield through various reanimation spells. It utilizes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces and control the game. The key strategy is to outpace the opponent by putting big threats into play early and overwhelming them with powerful creatures. The deck focuses on combining the speed of a combo deck with the resilience of a reanimator strategy to create a formidable and unpredictable threat on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to generate powerful card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining a mix of cheap artifacts and mana acceleration, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence while maintaining control with counterspells like Force of Will. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides recursion for artifacts while Urza's Bauble and Mishra's Bauble enable additional draws. Chalice of the Void can lock out opponent's spells, and Urza's Saga helps tutor for key artifacts. The deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent through a combination of tempo and resource advantage.

The deck focuses on leveraging artifacts and card draw to control the game by accessing key pieces like Paradox Engine and Urza's Saga. Emry, Lurker of the Loch acts as both a recurring threat and a way to bring back important artifacts from the graveyard. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with efficient card draw and incremental advantage, while also using artifacts like The One Ring and Urza's Bauble to generate additional resources. With a mix of control elements and artifact synergy, the deck aims to grind out victories through card advantage and incremental value.

This deck focuses on using a combination of disruptive creatures like Thalia and Skyclave Apparition, along with powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice, to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. Karakas and Flickerwisp provide additional disruption and flexibility, while Aether Vial allows for easy deployment of creatures at instant speed. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides a way to generate incremental advantage over time and out-value the opponent in longer games. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans while applying pressure to win quickly.

This Legacy deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and mana base while quickly deploying aggressive threats to close out the game. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also deploying powerful creatures like Hullbreacher and Azure Fleet Admiral to apply pressure, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, cards like Back to Basics and Day's Undoing further disrupt the opponent's strategy, giving this deck a strong tempo advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while developing a strong board presence. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Opposition Agent to disrupt the opponent's hand and steal their key cards. Reanimate and Dauthi Voidwalker are used to bring back creatures from the graveyard, while Troll of Khazad-dûm and Stalactite Stalker provide additional threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Cut to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through resource denial and efficient threats.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. By combining disruption with aggression, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and finish off the opponent quickly. With a mix of cheap removal, counterspells, and card draw, along with versatile threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, this deck can adapt to different situations and maintain a strong presence on the board. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.
